subject: Motrex - New Hire Presentation - Spanish Translation
body:
Hi Catalina, 
 
Hope all is well! We need your assistance with another translation project for Motrex. 
 
Below is a link to access their New Hire Presentation. A majority of this presentation (including notes) is similar to their previous open enrollment presentation so we are hoping we can get a favorable quote. 
 
https://sendit.alliant.com/download/default.aspx?ID=7iG0nIB1lUS1UP44FMDFkfZFXaASDFFCsmyvoNvnJmg
 
Please let us know if you have any questions. Thank you! 
 
Jay Heller
Lead Benefits Analyst
Alliant Employee Benefits
 
D
 (678) 867-6100
E
 
Jay.Heller@alliant.com
alliantbenefits.com
 
 
CA License No. 0C36861

 ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏
Hi there Catalina,
I wanted to give you a heads up that I will be out of the office April 1-12, with limited access to my email. Unfortunately, I won’t be able to take on any projects during this time and I look forward to working with you again after that. 
From April 23rd I will be working in CEST time zone as I am relocating back to Sweden where I will be looking for new opportunities in localization, content marketing or UX writing. I will continue working with current clients, but also looking for new employment.
Here’s a short summary of my experience:
🌍 What I Do:
🔹 Localization & Transcreation – Ensuring content doesn’t just translate, but truly resonates.
🔹 Content Strategy & UX Writing – Making digital experiences seamless across cultures.
🔹 SEO & Digital Marketing – Optimizing content for international visibility.
🔹 Community Growth & Engagement – Building brand trust through localized messaging.
🚀 My Experience Includes:
✅ Localizing and adapting marketing and UX content for the Swedish market for brands like Dropbox, Microsoft, and Skype.
✅ Leading SEO localization & digital content at Contentoo.
✅ Creating a successful content platform (Marketing Tips for Translators) with 10,000+ engaged followers and 6500 newsletter subscribers.
✅ Hosting an award-winning podcast with 280+ episodes on marketing and localization.
Warm regards, 
Tess Whitty
View email in browser
Swedish Translation Services · PO Box 982816 · Park City, UT 84098 · USA

What do I need to do with the Alliant Insurance Quote 7 MercyOne Quotes that are still active in Scoro? Or will Cecilia be able to take these over? Do these need to be invoiced?
Dustin recently did some work for Altera & DelMonte & submitted an invoice. Do you create a new Quote for this work in Scoro? If so, I would need help in doing that. Or, again, perhaps Cecilia can do.
Do we need to charge the client for this work Dustin did for Altera & DelMonte?
Anything else that needs to be entered into Scoro?

subject: You’ve been removed from the LCW Dropbox team
body:
Hi Catalina,
Your administrator has deleted your LCW Dropbox account. You will no longer have access to the account and any shared links you’ve created will be disabled. Your computer will no longer sync with website, other computers, or other devices.
Re-register email
Create a new account
FAQ
Why is this happening?
Because LCW has deleted your account. You will no longer have access to the account or any shared links you've created.
 
Where did my content go?
Your admin will decide where your content will go. You will lose access immediately or the admin may transfer your work files to another team member. 
Learn more
 
Where are my options?
Contact your administrator if you have any questions
Re-register or create a new account
Visit the 
Help Center
 to learn more about these changes and what your options are.

body:
Hello,
Del Monte has provided a response from their LMS. Please see below in 
blue
:
OData will present the score and if the employee fails, it will not show the course as complete on the employee's end. 
In the example below, you will see three "employees" who took the course. The two employees who passed show a score, whereas the employee who failed does not show a score in OData.
 
On the employee's end, this is what they will see.
Could this please be passed along to Dustin for review.
Thanks!
_________________________
Diligent
Randi Mooney,

EXTERNAL:
 This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 
 
Hello Randi, 
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Hello Randi,
Yes this is ready!
Please check his comments below:
 
I updated the Del Monte course for them to test on their end. This method involves the least amount of scope increase since we're at the translation phase. See below for what I did to the package to relay to them. Then can use the Menu to skip to the Certification slide to test both clickable decisions.
 
 
On the screen below, when the learner selects the No, the course will complete when the final slide loads. If the learner selects Yes, then the course will register as incomplete when reaching the final slide. 
If this is not enough for them, please have Del Monte describe how they are going to mitigate this issue for themselves internally with the limitations of their LMS, and we can adjust the package accordingly. 
Since their LMS doesn't allow the reportage they want, they need to decide how they are going to reach out to people who appear incomplete if this isn't good enough. That may even need to include adding language to the course that would then need translation. Reconfiguration/Testing of the course for numerical scores to be sent to signal the selected response in question, would take 1hr per language to adjust totaling $1400 ($140*10lg) additional to the scope on my end. The adjustment I did here would only increase the scope between $140-$280 overall to apply the fix.
 
 
Please let us know your comments.
Thanks!
CDS
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

Hi Catalina,
 
Ok, if any availability pops up today, please let me know and I will make that time work. But in the meantime, sent over an invite for Friday.
 
Here is a summary of the situation:
Del Monte noted earlier this week that the SCORM 2004 test file worked well in their LMS but followed up asking if we could send them their test report.
We informed them that without explicit access to their LMS and metadata, it would not be possible to generate a report on their behalf.
They replied that their LMS does not allow for any reports to be exported. This is where the misunderstanding occurred.
Earlier in the project, it was interpreted that they were not getting the desired information from SCORM 1.2 completion reports. That is why we decided to proceed with SCORM 2004 as it allows for customized reportage.
We have asked Del Monte to confirm with their LMS, Convercent, what type of reports or metadata can be generated or exported. Awaiting a response here.
Questions to discuss:
Is there any way to run a report on behalf of Del Monte?
Have reporting capabilities been brought up in the prior year updates for Del Monte? If so, what was the recommendation?
Thanks!
_________________________
Diligent

subject: Re: Dustin
body:
Hi. Thanks for this quick reply & info.
I think there may be some confusion.
We are supposed to use Keri now for e-learning & microlearning projects. We are not supposed to use Dustin anymore. At least I think that was the plan 🙂.  Not sure if you've met Keri yet. If not, we should schedule a call with her.
We can talk about this on our call tomorrow so we are aligned.
Thank you!
Nicole

subject: RE: Diligent - WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624 - Del Monte CoC
body:
Hi Catalina,
 
I shared the feedback and asked about better visibility on Convercent’s settings. I expect Del Monte to request for one more call with yourself, Dustin, and Convercent on the line to try to fine tune the details. Stay tuned for an update!
 
Thanks,
 
Don
 
 
From:
 Catalina De Sanctis <c.desanctis@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 25, 2025 6:17 AM
To:
 Randi Mooney <rmooney@diligent.com>
Cc:
 Brian Luong <bluong@diligent.com>; Don Reyes <dreyes@diligent.com>; Karen Lai <klai@diligent.com>; Kumud Mishra <kmishra@diligent.com>; Jorgelina Venturi <j.venturi@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Diligent - WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624 - Del Monte CoC
 
EXTERNAL:
 This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 
 
Hello Randi, 
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Subject:
 Re: Diligent - WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624 - Del Monte CoC
 
Hello,
 
Del Monte will be following up with their LMS on this matter. Also including another 
comment 
Del Monte provided below:
 
I just sent the question to Convercent but in the screenshot shared, it showed a score of 100 for completion and a blank score for incompletion, so I don't think it is pass/fail score? The issue we have is that we can't distinguish all blank scores that are incomplete, and we don't know if in fact they completed the course. We could even be ok with a blank score if the participant was able to complete the course.
 
Thanks,
_________________________
Diligent

Hello Randi,
Ready, please check below:
With testing I have the result below when selecting "No, I have nothing to report".
 
If the user selects "Yes, I have something to report", then they will get a "50% score" and the course will show incomplete. This said, if the 50% score is achieved it shows the learner DID complete the course VS someone with no score and an incomplete. Just to help their reportage find the users they need to call out to more efficiently. 
 
The file is on the server for them now. 
 
Let me know if they need any other adjustments.

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

 <
info@lcwmail.com

Subject:
 Application for Freelance French-to-English Translator Position
 
 
Hello Language & Culture Worldwide Team,
I am writing to express my interest in the Freelance French-to-English Translator position at your company. With over a decade of experience in the translation and localization industry, I have developed a strong specialization in international development, corporate communications, IT, telecoms, and pharmaceuticals.
As a native English speaker with extensive proficiency in French, I have successfully translated a diverse range of documents, including telecommunications manuals, IT websites, legal contracts, and marketing materials. My experience also extends to proofreading and writing, ensuring that all communications are accurate and culturally appropriate.
I am highly skilled in using various translation tools and technologies to enhance my workflow and maintain accuracy. I am confident in my ability to deliver high-quality translations tailored to your specifications and look forward to discussing how my skills can meet your company's needs.
Thank you for considering my application. Please find my resume attached.
 
Best regards,
 
Jordyn Paige Thomson
jp@thomsontranslations.com

subject: RE: Diligent - WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624 - Del Monte CoC
body:
Hello Randi, 
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Hello Randi,
Yes this is ready!
Please check his comments below:
 
I updated the Del Monte course for them to test on their end. This method involves the least amount of scope increase since we're at the translation phase. See below for what I did to the package to relay to them. Then can use the Menu to skip to the Certification slide to test both clickable decisions.
 
 
On the screen below, when the learner selects the No, the course will complete when the final slide loads. If the learner selects Yes, then the course will register as incomplete when reaching the final slide. 
If this is not enough for them, please have Del Monte describe how they are going to mitigate this issue for themselves internally with the limitations of their LMS, and we can adjust the package accordingly. 
Since their LMS doesn't allow the reportage they want, they need to decide how they are going to reach out to people who appear incomplete if this isn't good enough. That may even need to include adding language to the course that would then need translation. Reconfiguration/Testing of the course for numerical scores to be sent to signal the selected response in question, would take 1hr per language to adjust totaling $1400 ($140*10lg) additional to the scope on my end. The adjustment I did here would only increase the scope between $140-$280 overall to apply the fix.
 
 
Please let us know your comments.
Thanks!
CDS

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

Cc:
 Jorgelina Venturi <j.venturi@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Del monte course
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Best,
Dustin
 
On Tue, Feb 18, 2025 at 6:26
 
PM Catalina De Sanctis <
c.desanctis@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hello Dus, this is what client says, any idea why or how to change it?
 
Thank you for providing this new testable SCORM! Del Monte has started testing and noted the following:
 "Just tested it and we don't seem to get a score when I answer yes. I do get 100 if I answer no."
 
Including a screenshot that they provided below. Would you be able to provide some guidance on why they might not be seeing the 50% score if "Yes" is answered? 
 
 
Thanks!
 
CDS
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

>
Subject:
 Re: Del monte course
 
Hey Catalina!
 
With testing I have the result below when selecting "No, I have nothing to report".
 
If the user selects "Yes, I have something to report", then they will get a "50% score" and the course will show incomplete. This said, if the 50% score is achieved it shows the learner DID complete the course VS someone with no score and an incomplete. Just to help their reportage find the users they need to call out to more efficiently. 
 
The file is on the server for them now. 
 
Let me know if they need any other adjustments.
 
Best,
Dustin

 Monday, February 10, 2025 4:01 PM
To:
 Catalina De Sanctis <
c.desanctis@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Del monte course
 
I updated the Del Monte course for them to test on their end. This method involves the least amount of scope increase since we're at the translation phase. See below for what I did to the package to relay to them. Then can use the Menu to skip to the Certification slide to test both clickable decisions.
 
 
On the screen below, when the learner selects the No, the course will complete when the final slide loads. If the learner selects Yes, then the course will register as incomplete when reaching the final slide. 
If this is not enough for them, please have Del Monte describe how they are going to mitigate this issue for themselves internally with the limitations of their LMS, and we can adjust the package accordingly. 
Since their LMS doesn't allow the reportage they want, they need to decide how they are going to reach out to people who appear incomplete if this isn't good enough. That may even need to include adding language to the course that would then need translation. Reconfiguration/Testing of the course for numerical scores to be sent to signal the selected response in question, would take 1hr per language to adjust totaling $715 additional to the scope on my end. The adjustment I did here would only increase the scope between $65-$130 overall to apply the fix.
 
 
Let me know if you have any questions. 
 
Best,
Dustin

Hopefully, the Dilignt team can use some of the previous translation work as a few of the slides have the same if not very similar content from previous years.”

Thank you,
Karen

subject: RE: Lina Onboarding
body:
Hello ladies,
I would be happy to cover that those 2 exact days I´m travelling to Argentina so I´ll be in the middle of flights. I wish It was an hour flight!
 
Honestly, I haven’t taken any days off and even checked emails when the office is close.
From what I see, lately it has been super quiet and I´m already finalizing the 2 Diligent projects we have.
 
I would advise to send an email in advance to Alliant and Diligent letting them know that you will be off during those 2 days and if any urgent request to contact Nicole and we see how to solve it. What comes to m mind the only urgent may come up If needed to be something for Dustin to answer.
If you can have 5 min connection to check emails just in case it would be awesome.
 
Kindly,
CDS
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW
